definitions: To make something accessible or available.
To start to talk more about your feelings and thoughts.
To start a business or activity.
To make something wider or less restricted.
examples: They decided to open up a new branch in the city.
It took him a long time to open up about his past.
The new road will open up the area to more tourists.
The detective tried to get the suspect to open up.
The flowers open up in the morning sun.
